title: Nonlinear Pedagogical Theory and Application in Physical Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Physical Education Theory and Practical Experience
context.additional_context: Exploring motor skill acquisition methods based on ecological dynamics theory, including case analyses of field applications referencing Singapore

learning_goals: Learners can explain core principles of nonlinear pedagogy (e.g., personalized movement solutions, environment-task-learner interactions).
Learners can propose three or more methodologies for applying ecological dynamics theory to physical education design.
Learners can draft lesson plans utilizing nonlinear pedagogy in blended (online/offline) environments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
